title: Notice on Declaring a National Emergency at the Southern Border of the United States
summary: On July 15, 2025, the President issued a notice extending the authorization of a national emergency at the southern border of the United States, initially declared on January 20, 2025, due to an attack on American sovereignty by foreign criminal gangs and aliens. The notice invoked 10 U.S.C. 12302, authorizing the Secretary of Homeland Security to utilize the United States Coast Guard to support the federal government's response to the emergency. This extension is critical for ensuring the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the United States and safeguarding its maritime borders. The notice was published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress. The document is dated July 15, 2025, and filed on August 2, 2025.
